task.title: Offline Instance Migration to RHEL 7 Using a Single NC
task.shortdesc: This topic describes offline instance migration within a single NC, using the pack/unpack utility and off-machine (or local persistent) storage.

prereq.p: Before offline instance migration using a single NC, ensure that:

ul.li: You understand the risks of offline migration using a single NC, as described in .
You have successfully backed up your cloud state. See .
You have sufficient off-machine (or local persistent storage) to hold packed instances during the upgrade.
You are prepared for all instances to be unavailable during the migration process.

context.p: This offline migration scenario begins by suspending instances on the NC running RHEL 6 and then packing their state to disk, creating an instance snapshot.
The instance snapshot must be kept in persistent storage that is accessible to the NC, yet will not be affected when the NC is wiped clean for and RHEL 7 installs.
Once the NC is running RHEL 7, the instance snapshot can be unpacked to the NC.

p.b: To perform an offline instance migration to on RHEL 7

step.cmd: Pack the instance on the RHEL 6 NC.

info.p: You have the option to pack all the instances on an NC or to choose a specific instance for migration. For example, you might want to move a specific instance to another NC in a separate migration.
info.note: Be sure you have packed all the instances that you need to migrate before proceeding to the next step.
info.p: See XREF TO Pack Instances for Offline Migration.

step.cmd: Move the packed file(s) to a safe, persistent storage area that will not be affected by the clean OS install.

info.note: It is critical that the cloud state backup and the packed instance snapshot(s) are valid and held in persistent storage that will be unaffected by the and RHEL 7 installs in the following steps.

step.cmd: Upgrade the NC from RHEL 6 to RHEL 7.
step.info: See XREF TO Upgrade NC Host Machines to RHEL 7 and EUCA 4.3.

step.cmd: Copy the packed file to the newly upgraded RHEL 7 NC.
Unpack the instance on the newly upgraded RHEL 7 NC.
step.info: See XREF TO Unpack Instances for Offline Migration.

result.p: The instance has now been migrated to on RHEL 7.
